relatedanime.anime: Alps no Shoujo Heidi: Alm no Yama Hen

Hello Kitty no Alps no Shoujo Heidi

recommendations.recommendation: Good, old anime. Quite enjoyable and hearthwarming. It reminds you, your childhood. You can call, It`s one of the best world masterpiece theater series.

anime.description: Heidi is a 5-year-old girl, whose parents died when she was only one. Although her Aunt Dete has since cared for her, Heidi has led a very lonely life as she`s been given to one person or another to be cared for. Now her aunt is tired of the burden and has left young Heidi with the care of Heidi`s grandfather who`s also known as the Alm-Uncle, a mountain hermit, that is feared by the village folk. With Heidi now living in the mountains with her grandfather, her life begins to change as do the lives of her grandfather and the 11-year-old orphan, Goatherder Peter.

externalentity.identifier: アルプスの少女ハイジ_(アニメ)

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: past
tag.description: Anime that takes place in the past or clearly seems to take place in the past in case of an alternative universe. This category should almost always go together with one of its sub-categories, because the past can either be a depiction of a historical event(s) or not, in which case it would be alternative past.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: historical
tag.description: Historical anime have clear ties to our history and usually occur in a particular epoch.

tag.name: plot continuity
tag.description: Consistency of the characteristics of persons, plot, objects, places and events seen by the viewer. A single linear focused plot is highly continuous. A truly random plot is highly discontinuous.

tag.name: novel
tag.description: A novel is a relatively long work of narrative fiction, normally written in prose form, and which is typically published as a book. Manga, comics, or visual novels do not fit this description and are not considered novels; including a small number of illustrations, however, is still permissible, which means that light novels are considered novels.

tag.name: Germany
tag.description: Germany, officially the Federal Republic of Germany, is a federal parliamentary republic in central-western Europe. It includes 16 constituent states, and has a largely temperate seasonal climate. Germany is the most populous member state of the European Union. Germany`s capital and largest metropolis is Berlin, while its largest conurbation is the Ruhr, with its main centres of Dortmund and Essen. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: Europe
tag.description: Europe is a continent located entirely in the Northern Hemisphere and mostly in the Eastern Hemisphere. It is bordered by the Arctic Ocean to the north, the Atlantic Ocean to the west, and the Mediterranean Sea to the south. It comprises the westernmost part of Eurasia. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: adventure
tag.description: Adventures are exciting stories, with new experiences or exotic locales. Adventures are designed to provide an action-filled, energetic experience for the viewer. Rather than the predominant emphasis on violence and fighting that is found in pure action anime, however, the viewer of adventures can live vicariously through the travels, conquests, explorations, creation of empires, struggles and situations that confront the main characters, actual historical figures or protagonists. Under the category of adventures, we can include traditional swashbucklers, serialized films, and historical spectacles, searches or expeditions for lost continents, "jungle" and "desert" epics, treasure hunts and quests, disaster films, and heroic journeys or searches for the unknown. Adventure films are often, but not always, set in an historical period, and may include adapted stories of historical or literary adventure heroes, kings, battles, rebellion, or piracy.

tag.name: friendship
tag.description: The feeling of trust, kindness, and friendship between a group of high school students for example, is a central theme of this anime.

tag.name: daily life
tag.description: The antics of the protagonists do not take place in some exotic setting or time, but in everyday life. When not "at the job" this means getting up in the morning, making meals, house cleaning, going shopping or out to eat, visiting the bath house or spa, leisure activities in the spare time, etc. The time "on the job" for students is School Life, for others working in their profession. Daily Life is basically a synonym for everything normal, repetitive, and trivial happening to your average person.

tag.name: ecology
tag.description: Nature and ecology are a central theme of this anime.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: particularly suitable for children
tag.description: No sex or drugs, but probably rock and roll. Very watchable for children.

tag.name: Sekai Meisaku Gekijou
tag.description: World Masterpiece Theatre is a Japanese TV anime staple that showcases an animated version of a different classical book or story each year. It originally aired from 1969 to 1997 and then resumed in 2007. WMT series were originally produced by http://anidb.net/cr833 [Mushi Production] and Zuiyo Eizo, and then by the latter`s successor http://anidb.net/cr728 [Nippon Animation], and originally air primarily on http://anidb.net/cr741 [Fuji Television]. The series has been known by various different names over the years, often reflecting changes to the sponsors, but "World Masterpiece Theatre" is the name most commonly used by viewers. Nippon Animation`s official English name for the series is The Classic Family Theater Series. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: strong female lead
tag.description: The lead female character has a strong personality and plays a part that is not the typical damsel-in-distress role. This is the exact opposite of the “damsel in distress” tag.

tag.name: Switzerland
tag.description: Switzerland, officially the Swiss Confederation is a federal republic in Europe. While still named the "Swiss Confederation" for historical reasons, modern Switzerland is a federal directorial republic consisting of 26 cantons, with Bern as the seat of the federal authorities, called "federal city". The country is situated in Western-Central Europe, and is bordered by Italy to the south, France to the west, Germany to the north, and Austria and Liechtenstein to the east. Switzerland is a landlocked country geographically divided between the Alps, the Swiss Plateau and the Jura, spanning an area of 41,285 km². While the Alps occupy the greater part of the territory, the Swiss population of approximately eight million people is concentrated mostly on the plateau, where the largest cities are to be found: among them are the two global and economic centres Zürich and Geneva. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: multi-anime projects
tag.description: Many anime are created as part of larger projects encompassing many shows without direct relation to one another. Normally, there is a specific idea in mind: for example, the http://anidb.net/t4859 [Young Animator Training Project] aims to stimulate the on-the-job training of next-generation professionals of the anime industry, whereas the http://anidb.net/t3763 [World Masterpiece Theatre] aims to animate classical stories from all over the world.

character.name: Heidi
character.description: Heidi is an orphan child, happy and carefree, loving and interested in everything that happens around her. Whether its the ringing of church bells, the sounds of the trees, her grandfather`s homemade cheese or fresh cheese cake - Heidi appreciates the little things of everyday life. Because she is always helpful and caring, Heidi soon wins the hearts of all. And of course she would never exchange the beloved animals and mountains against the confines of city life.

character.name: Ojiisan
character.description: The grumpy old grandfather of Heidi lives like a hermit in a small hut on his alm. He has little contact with the inhabitants of the village below and they in return think he is strange and avoid him. When Heidi`s aunt drops her off at his place he is far from happy about it. He soon learns to appreciate Heidi`s joyful, honest way which also makes him more helpful and friendly towards other people.

character.name: Peter
character.description: Peter is Heidi`s best friend. He is a friendly character, energetic and always hungry but always reliable when he is needed. He lives with his mother and grandmother, providing for their lives as a goatherder. Peter does not like to go to school because he has difficulties at learning to read.

character.name: Clara Sesemann
character.description: Clara Sesemann, daughter of a wealthy merchant is bound to a wheelchair and lives (motherless) with her governess Miss Rottenmeier and a butler in a mansion in Frankfurt. Her father is constantly on the road and has little time for his daughter. So Clara is lonely and unhappy - until Heidi appears in her life. The two immediately become friends.

character.name: Rottenmeier
character.description: The strict governess is responsible for Mr. Sesemann`s household and for Clara`s wellbeing and education. When Heidi comes to Frankfurt, Miss Rottenmeier has tremendous difficulties in coping with the open and cheerful nature of the little girl. She believes Heidi is too wild and must be tamed.

character.name: Sesemann
character.description: Mr. Sesemann is a wealthy merchant, widow and Clara`s father. He loves his daughter dearly but has very little time for her since his work requires him to travel extensively.

character.name: Joseph
character.description: Grandfather`s St. Bernard Joseph is a loyal companion in Heidi and Peter`s adventures. Ge bravely helps his friends whenever it is needed but prefers to lie lazily in the sun, taking a nap. One of his favourite snacks are snails.

character.name: Obaasan
character.description: Peter`s grandmother who has gone blind and spends a lot of time sitting at her spinning wheel, enjoys it when Heidi reads to her. She treats Heidi quite naturally as a family member. Heidi in return treats her as if she were her grandmother.

character.name: Thomas
character.description: A friendly guy with a horse carriage.

character.name: Dete
character.description: Heidi`s aunt. She took care of Heidi after her parents died, but after being offered a good job in Frankfurt, she won`t have the time anymore. Thus she sends Heidi off to the Alps, to be with her grandfather.

character.name: Brigitte
character.description: Peter`s mother.

character.name: Strahl
character.description: Herr Strahl lives in Dörfli and is the owner of Heidi`s favourite Goat Yuki-chan. Note: Even though he doesn`t have many appearances, his voice actor changes.

character.name: Sebastian
character.description: Sebastian is part of the house staff in the Frankfurt Sesemann residence.

character.name: Tinette
character.description: Tinette is a maid in the Frankfurt Sesemann residence.

character.name: Johann
character.description: Johann is part of the Frankfurt Sesemann residence household.

character.name: Kateikyoushi
character.description: The tutor (Kateikyoushi) of Clara and Heidi.

character.name: Organ Hiki no Shounen
character.description: A boy standing on the streets of Frankfurt/Main and playing the organ for money.

character.name: Toomori
character.description: The caretaker of the church tower (Toomori).

character.name: Clara no Obaa-sama
character.description: Clara`s grandmother. A very kind and joyful woman that is also delighted by Heidi`s presence. She`s very down to earth and treats people with respect.

character.name: Oisha-sama
character.description: Clara`s doctor and a good friend to her father. He even goes so far as to have his vacation in the Swiss Alps to see if the place would be good for Clara and her health.

character.name: Dorfli Mura no Yanushi
character.description: The man whose house will be empty in the winter. Heidi`s grandfather asks him to rent his house there so the both of them can live there during the winter - a time when the children around the area are supposed to attend school.

character.name: Dorfli Mura no Gakkou no Sensei
character.description: He`s the teacher in Dörfli, the village Peter and Heidi attend school in.
